params.name: description
params.doc: Optional description of the `Adjust Points` request.

description: Adjusts the point balance of an account.

params.name: contactId
params.doc: Contact ID. See [Contacts API](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/contacts/contacts/contacts-v4/contact-object) for more details.

params.name: amount
params.doc: Amount of points to earn. Must be a whole number integer lower than 10 million.

params.name: _id
params.doc: ID of the account to retrieve.

params.name: contactId
params.doc: Contact ID. See [Contacts API](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/contacts/contacts/contacts-v4/contact-object) for more details.

description: Retrieves the account belonging to the specified contact or member.

params.name: contactIds
params.doc: List of contact IDs. See [Contacts API](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/contacts/contacts/contacts-v4/contact-object) for more details.

description: Retrieves a list of accounts, given the provided filters.

params.doc:
TODO: This is not implemented and we can implement it later
copied from https://github.com/wix-private/p13n/blob/master/protos/query/src/main/proto/wix/common/query.proto

description:
Retrieves a list of transactions, given the provided filters.
TODO: move to new transactions service

params.name: limit
params.doc: Number of items to load. Minimum `1`, maximum `50`.

params.name: rewardId
params.doc: Reward ID. See [Rewards API](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/loyalty/rewards/rewards-object) for more details.

description: Redeems points from an account, given the provided reward.

members.name: sourceAccounts
members.doc: Source accounts.

members.name: updatedAccount
members.doc: Merged account.

members.name: accountId
members.doc: Account ID.

members.name: amount
members.doc: Adjusts point balance by the specified amount. Must be a whole number with a maximum of 7 digits. Can be negative, but not `0`.

members.name: balance
members.doc: Sets new point balance. Must be a positive whole number lower than 1 billion.

members.name: description
members.doc: Optional description of the `Adjust Points` request.

members.name: revision
members.doc:
Revision number. Increments by 1 each time the point balance is adjusted.
To prevent conflicting changes, the existing `revision` must be used when adjusting the point balance.

members.name: account
members.doc: Loyalty account.

members.name: contactId
members.doc: Contact ID. See [Contacts API](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/contacts/contacts/contacts-v4/contact-object) for more details.

members.name: account
members.doc: Loyalty account.

members.name: cursor
members.doc: Cursor returned in last query response. Should not be provided on first page request

members.name: limit
members.doc:
The number of items to load.
Cursor token returned in the query response. To be used on the next query request, but not the first query request.

members.name: next
members.doc: Cursor pointing to next result page.

members.name: prev
members.doc: Cursor pointing to previous result page.

members.name: _id
members.doc: random GUID so clients can tell if event was already handled

members.name: entityFqdn
members.doc:
Assumes actions are also always typed to an entity_type
Example: wix.stores.catalog.product, wix.bookings.session, wix.payments.transaction

members.name: entityId
members.doc:
Assuming that all messages including Actions have id
Example: The id of the specific order, the id of a specific campaign

members.name: eventTime
members.doc: The time of the event. Useful if there was a delay in dipatching

members.name: originatedFrom
members.doc: If present, indicates the action that triggered the event.

members.name: slug
members.doc:
This is top level to ease client code dipatching of messages (switch on entity_fqdn+slug)
This is although the created/updated/deleted notion is duplication of the oneof types
Example: created/updated/deleted/started/completed/email_opened

members.name: triggeredByAnonymizeRequest
members.doc:
A field that should be set if this event was triggered by an anonymize request.
For example you must set it to true when sending an event as a result of a GDPR right to be forgotten request.
NOTE: This field is not relevant for `EntityCreatedEvent` but is located here for better ergonomics of consumers.

members.name: accountId
members.doc: Account ID.

members.name: amount
members.doc: Amount of points to earn. Must be a whole number integer lower than 10 million.

members.name: appId
members.doc:
ID of the app that initiated the transaction.
Matches the automation's `sourceUniqueId` if points were earned in an automatic event.
Matches Loyalty `appDefId` if points were earned manually.

members.name: description
members.doc: Optional description of the `Earn Points` request. Maximum supported text length is 100 characters.

members.name: idempotencyKey
members.doc: Idempotency key. Only present if points were added manually.

members.name: account
members.doc: Loyalty account.

members.name: triggeredByUndelete
members.doc: Indicates the event was trigered on a previous deleted entity

members.name: currentEntityAsJson
members.doc:
Since platformized APIs only expose PATCH and not PUT we can't assume that the fields sent from the client are the actual diff.
This means that to generate a list of changed fields (as opposed to sent fields) one needs to traverse both objects.
We don't want to impose this on all developers and so we leave this traversal to the notification recipients which need it.

members.name: previousEntityAsJson
members.doc:
This field is currently part of the of the EntityUpdatedEvent msg, but scala/node libraries which implements the domain events standard
wont populate it / have any reference to it in the API.
The main reason for it is that fetching the old entity from the DB will have a performance hit on an update operation so unless truly needed,
the developer should send only the new (current) entity.
An additional reason is not wanting to send this additional entity over the wire (kafka) since in some cases it can be really big
Developers that must reflect the old entity will have to implement their own domain event sender mechanism which will follow the DomainEvent proto message.

members.name: contactId
members.doc: Contact ID. See [Contacts API](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/contacts/contacts/contacts-v4/contact-object) for more details.

members.name: memberId
members.doc: Member ID. See [Members API](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/members/members/member-object) for more details.

members.doc: Loyalty account.

members.doc: ID of the account to retrieve.

members.name: account
members.doc: Loyalty account.

members.name: account
members.doc: Loyalty account.

members.name: points
members.doc: Program totals.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Transaction ID.

members.name: transaction
members.doc: Retrieved transaction.

members.name: _createdDate
members.doc: Date and time of the latest transaction.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Transaction ID.

members.name: amount
members.doc: Amount of earned, adjusted, or redeemed points in the latest transaction.

members.name: appId
members.doc: ID of the app that initiated the transaction.

members.name: description
members.doc: Description of the latest transaction.

members.name: idempotencyKey
members.doc: Idempotency key. Only present if points were added manually.

members.name: rewardId
members.doc: Reward ID. Only present if `type`  is `REDEEM`.

members.name: type
members.doc: Transaction type.

members.name: contactIds
members.doc: List of contact IDs. See [Contacts API](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/contacts/contacts/contacts-v4/contact-object) for more details.

members.name: accounts
members.doc: Loyalty accounts.

members.name: accountId
members.doc: Account ID.

members.name: cursorPaging
members.doc:
TODO: This is not implemented and we can implement it later
copied from https://github.com/wix-private/p13n/blob/master/protos/query/src/main/proto/wix/common/query.proto

members.name: transactions
members.doc: Retrieved transactions.

members.name: limit
members.doc: Number of items to load. Minimum `1`, maximum `50`.

members.name: offset
members.doc: Number of items to skip in the current sort order.

members.name: accounts
members.doc: Loyalty accounts.

members.name: _createdDate
members.doc: Date and time the account was created.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Account ID.

members.name: _updatedDate
members.doc: Date and time the account was last updated.

members.name: contactId
members.doc: Contact ID. See [Contacts API](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/contacts/contacts/contacts-v4/contact-object) for more details.

members.name: latestTransaction
members.doc: Details of the account's latest transaction.

members.name: memberId
members.doc: Member ID. See [Members API](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/members/members/member-object) for more details.

members.name: points
members.doc: Information about the account totals.

members.name: revision
members.doc:
Revision number. Increments by 1 each time the account is updated.
To prevent conflicting changes, the existing `revision` must be used when updating an account.

members.name: rewardAvailable
members.doc: Whether the account has an available reward.

members.name: account
members.doc: Loyalty account.

members.name: metaSiteId
members.doc: Metasite ID.

members.name: count
members.doc: Number of items returned in the response.

members.name: cursors
members.doc: Cursors to navigate through the result pages using `next` and `prev`. Returned if cursor paging is used.

members.name: hasNext
members.doc:
Indicates if there are more results after the current page.
If `true`, another page of results can be retrieved.
If `false`, this is the last page.

members.name: offset
members.doc: Offset that was requested.

members.name: tooManyToCount
members.doc: Flag that indicates the server failed to calculate the `total` field.

members.name: total
members.doc: Total number of items that match the query. Returned if offset paging is used and the `tooManyToCount` flag is not set.

members.name: adjusted
members.doc: Total adjusted points.

members.name: balance
members.doc: Point balance. Equal to the sum of earned and adjusted points minus redeemed points.

members.name: earned
members.doc: Total earned points.

members.name: redeemed
members.doc: Total redeemed points.

members.name: account
members.doc: Updated account.

members.name: accountId
members.doc: Account ID.

members.name: count
members.doc: Number of times the given reward will be redeemed. Must be a positive whole number.

members.name: revision
members.doc:
Revision number. Increments by 1 each time points are redeemed.
To prevent conflicting changes, the existing `revision` must be used when redeeming points.

members.name: rewardId
members.doc: Reward ID. See [Rewards API](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/loyalty/rewards/rewards-object) for more details.

members.name: account
members.doc: Loyalty account.

members.name: _createdDate
members.doc: Date and time of the transaction.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Transaction ID.

members.name: accountId
members.doc: Account ID.

members.name: amount
members.doc: Points earned, adjusted, or redeemed in the latest transaction.

members.name: appId
members.doc: ID of the app that initiated the transaction.

members.name: contactId
members.doc: Contact ID. See [Contacts API](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/contacts/contacts/contacts-v4/contact-object) for more details.

members.name: description
members.doc: Transaction description. Only present for automated transactions of `type` `EARN` or `REDEEM`, when set by the site owner in the Business Manager.

members.name: idempotencyKey
members.doc: Idempotency key. Only present if points were added manually.

members.name: memberId
members.doc: Member ID. See [Members API](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/members/members/member-object) for more details.

members.name: rewardId
members.doc: Reward ID. Only present if `type` is `REDEEM`.
